bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Document Disposal Act applies to the corporation and, for the purposes of that Act, the corporation is a ministerial office, as defined in that Act.

change.changenote: Section 25 (2) BEFORE amended by 2015-18-302, effective November 28, 2016 (BC Reg 216/2015).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may direct that specified provisions of the Business Corporations Act or the Society Act apply to the corporation.

change.changenote: Section 26 (1) BEFORE amended by 2015-27-34, effective May 10, 2016 (BC Reg 109/2016).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite the Document Disposal Act but subject to the regulations,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister, in writing, may transfer records to the corporation, and
the corporation, in writing, may transfer records to the minister.

change.changenote: Section 35 BEFORE repealed by 2013-6-35(3), effective March 18, 2016 [3 years after s. 35 coming into force].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations it considers necessary or advisable to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: more effectively bring this Act into operation, or

remedy any transitional difficulties, in respect of any matter, encountered in the transition from the corporation as established under the Business Corporations Act to the corporation as continued under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For 3 years after the date this section comes into force, a regulation made under this section may be made retroactive to a date not earlier than the date this Act or any provision of this Act comes into force and, if made retroactive, is deemed to come into force on the date specified in the regulation.
This section is repealed 3 years after the date it comes into force and, on its repeal, any regulations made under it, unless earlier repealed, are also repealed.
